ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a strong foundation in the Spanish language. I went into the course with zero Spanish experience. I am exiting the course with conversational skills.
My Spanish skills increased greatly. Although I have taken Spanish before, we covered content that I've never been exposed to before.
I learned basic Spanish grammar and a lot of vocabulary. I learned a bit about Spanish culture and had practice presenting/discussing topics in Spanish.
Basic understanding of Spanish language and grammar
I developed the skill of speaking Spanish. I also learned how to manage daily assignments in a fast-paced class.
After taking this class, now I know how to construct basic sentences in Spanish.

I learned how to understand, speak, and write in Spanish with slight fluency. At the end of this course, I could nearly always understand instructions which were given exclusively in Spanish. I also feel immensely confident in my ability to write. I feel less confident in my ability to speak on demand.
My skills and ability of speaking and writing in Spanish improved so much from this course. Also learned extensive background of Hispanic culture.
I think I was able to learn a good amount of Spanish very quickly in this class.
I have gained a basic level of writing, speaking, listening, and reading skills in Spanish. I also cultivated a preliminary understanding of the Spanish culture and history.
Excellent introductory Spanish class - covers a lot in one semester

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Spanish 110 moves ridiculously quickly; I felt like I was drowning. I'd say over 70% of my class had taken Spanish in high school. As a result, the student's levels were variable. This was a bit disheartening at times.

Strengths: Very comprehensive and detailed
Weakness: Supersite sometimes felt like busy work rather than work that would improve my skills. Sometimes I felt like I was dedicating time to getting the assignments done when I could be studying the material on my own. 

Having supersite as an optional learning method would be PERFECT. This would provide students the ability to practice their skills, but also not feel like it is a chore to get done for a grade.

The SuperSite homework was helpful but repetitivehaving more flexible deadlines for the activities, even a 1-day grace period, would have been good. I also think that sections could be more standardized, more information on midterms could be given at least a week in advance, and more clarity about the digital project expectations could be provided.

Course felt a little disorganized. It felt like everyday we were doing something new and not always connected to what we did the day before. I wish we had more of a road map for grammar and why we were learning it in that specific order.

I think a weakness of this course is the varied levels. Some people come into L1 Spanish with truly no experience, whiles others have taken four years of Spanish. As someone who had never taken a Spanish class, I felt unprepared for the course. I was able to adjust as the course went on, but it was a difficult start.

This course was very effective in the amount I practiced writing and comprehending Spanish. I would recommend in future semesters stressing speaking on demand in Spanish slightly more, outside of linguameetings.

Strength: a lot of interactions in class and with homework
Improvement: N/A

I think this course moves way too quickly which makes it extremely difficult to actually retain the language. Along with this, there were way too many sudden changes to the syllabus making it difficult and inconsistent. Also, I feel that we spent little time focusing on the things that are hard to retain like verb conjugation and too much time focusing on vocabulary retention, which was really frustrating. I also think that the attendance policy was far too strict, I was sick multiple times this semester and unfortunately my grade suffered because of it.
The textbook's explanation of grammar is sometimes not very clear, but the online exercises that came along with the textbook are very helpful.
Strength is the amount of engagement with Spanish with classes and homeworks every day but its also the weakness as some stuff is rushed

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you are good at learning languages, I would take the class. I am terrible at learning languages; Spanish 110 was my hardest class this semester. If you want to breeze through the language requirement, DO NOT take Spanish. The class is a lot of work, and you actually need to study.

Yes, I would recommend this for people who would like to one day achieve fluency in Spanish and have a background in Spanish. Although it is a beginner course, It would be VERY overwhelming as a beginner. It was difficult for me at times and I took Spanish for 3 years.
If you are really interested in learning Spanish I would take this course, it does move pretty fast though so the success of the student depends on how much time (daily) they are willing to commit.
I wouldn't. I would choose to take a different language where the instructor/student relationships are better.
I would recommend this course to students who really want to learn Spanish.
I would recommend this class to anyone who wants to learn Spanish. This course touches on basic Spanish grammar and vocabulary.
Yes. I feel confident in my ability to move up a level next semester and felt that my instruction was highly rewarding.
Strongly recommend
I honestly would not recommend this course. As someone who has experience in learning language, this course made learning Spanish feel unnatural and too quick.
Yes, this is a great introductory course to the Spanish language.
Definitely
